channel.title: FortressCraft
channel.description:
My friends and I were discussing MineCraft and my one friend said MineCraft was coming to PS3 and Xbox 360, which excited me. I enjoy playing MineCraft, and it would be cool to be able to play with friends while sitting on the couch or laying in bed being lazy all day. So I did some looking into it. I couldn't really find proof that Mojang was going to move into household console's which saddens me because it is such a great game. But I discovered this game... "FortressCraft" or in other terms a MineCraft knock off. [img]http://nextgengamingnews.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/FortressCraft001.png[/img] [img]http://www.dealspwn.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/005.jpg[/img] [img]http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5291/5470976853_65fedf27a7.jpg[/img] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vKd6fdiuVhQ It's a nice game but makes me upset that someone would do this.
As Mojang ports Minecraft onto portable platforms, a wholly unrelated group is cashing in on the block-moving train with FortressCraft on Xbox Live Indie Games. What amounts to a blatant knock-off of Minecraft, FortressCraft is impressive nonetheless. Releasing this spring for 80MS points ($1), the game’s first chapter, “The Creation”, will feature world building and 31 player multiplayer. Subsequent chapters are also in the works, also for $1, and there are even plans to port FortressCraft to Windows, Mac, Linux and browsers. At this point, you’re probably wondering how in the hell these guys are going to avoid a lawsuit from Mojang. Well, they answer that in the FAQ: Q: Doesn’t this infringe Mojang’s copyright? A: No it doesn’t infringe copyright. All the graphics, code, branding and trademarks are our own. I’ll feel dirty doing it, but there’s nothing that’s going to stop me from checking this out when it releases. Of course, should Mojang ever decide to put the real deal on Xbox, they’ll surely get my money again. Until then, this looks to be the best way to get your Minecraft fix from the comfort of your couch.
http://www.fortresscraft.com/

item.title: FortressCraft
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Fuck you PSN, minecraft is the shit. And appearently, so is fortress craft.

Read full topic

item.title: FortressCraft
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:18, topic:386830”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=482598.msg3535749#msg3535749 date=1300555270]

Look up infiniminer.

Minecraft was not the first.
[/quote]http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Infiniminer

That sounds like a cool game actually.

They also need fortress craft for psn
Tell the guy who coded it to make it for ps3 :p[/quote]

So your plans only include the Xbox 360 so far? What about for those of us who can't access XBLIG in my countries, or don't have an Xbox?!

Initially FortressCraft will only be available on XBLIG, however I am looking at PC distribution methods. If I can get distribution sorted for FortessCraft on the PC it will probably be more along the lines of “pay $X and you get all updates ever”. Unfortunately Sony doesn’t provide indie games support like Microsoft does, so it’s incredibly unlikely that FortressCraft will see a PSN release.

Read full topic

item.title: FortressCraft
item.dc:creator: @Fuse Fuse
item.description:
@Fuse wrote:

Minecraft reminds me of Doom. I remember when I played Doom 3 on the Xbox, it was a 3D model version… I preferred Doom classic, because it was… classic.

The same applies with this (in concept, as I have not played Minecraft fully yet).

item.title: FortressCraft
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:5, topic:386830”]i hate how idiots try to copy the great game of minecraft even the name was copied

its just minecraft classic wit better graphics and beta stuff added besides hearts and mobs lol[/quote]

Why call it ___craft if you want to avoid being called a Minecraft clone?

The project was originally started almost two years ago as a Dwarf Fortress style game (called Diggers), hence the Fortress part of the name. It was put on the shelf as I couldn’t get it running well, but in the last 18 months or so I have learned a lot, and having played a lot of Minecraft I came back to the game with some fresh ideas about how to achieve the game I wanted to write. Hence the name is an amalgamation of two of the major influences on the game - Dwarf Fortress and Minecraft.

I’d like to see you make it.

Read full topic
